title: How to Grill Salmon on a Natural Cedar Plank

steps.headline: Select the appropriate size natural oval cedar plank.
steps.description: The one pictured is 6"x18" but a 6"x12" is usually sufficient for most fillets. Soak the plank in water for at least two hours to reconstitute the plank to its natural state, rather like a dehydrated vegetable.

steps.headline: Rub a light coat of olive oil onto the plank to prevent sticking.
Lay salmon fillet or steaks on plank with the skin down
Mix 1/4 cup maple syrup, two tablespoons soy sauce, one teaspoon garlic powder,and the juice of 4 lemon wedges.
Pour 2/3 mixture over salmon.
steps.description: Arrange spent lemon wedges on fillet

steps.headline: Place the plank directly on grilling surface of ready to cook charcoal or propane grill.
Close grill cover and cook for approximately 20 minutes or until the color is mostly opaque and the fish is flaky.
Drizzle remaining sauce on salmon and serve on the plank.

text: Select the appropriate size natural oval cedar plank. The one pictured is 6"x18" but a 6"x12" is usually sufficient for most fillets. Soak the plank in water for at least two hours to reconstitute the plank to its natural state, rather like a dehydrated vegetable. Rub a light coat of olive oil onto the plank to prevent sticking.  Lay salmon fillet or steaks on plank with the skin down  Mix 1/4 cup maple syrup, two tablespoons soy sauce, one teaspoon garlic powder,and the juice of 4 lemon wedges.  Pour 2/3 mixture over salmon. Arrange spent lemon wedges on fillet Place the plank directly on grilling surface of ready to cook charcoal or propane grill.  Close grill cover and cook for approximately 20 minutes or until the color is mostly opaque and the fish is flaky.  Drizzle remaining sauce on salmon and serve on the plank.  Finished.
